main event: A witness observed a cloudlike object with glowing lights that appeared stationary, broke into parts, and flew erratically in Bartlett, Illinois on December 29, 1961.
interesting points: The object emitted golden-red lights, resembling a shining sun; it disappeared over the horizon and then reappeared, pulling a banner; multiple pieces of the object were observed breaking off during the sighting; the observation lasted about 10 minutes and was made just before sunset; the witness concluded that the object may have been a type of unconventional aircraft due to its speed and maneuverability.
sighted object: a cloudlike object with glowing lights
witness description: A female resident of Bartlett, Illinois who observed the object.
